sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: No relief in sight as fighting in Gaza enters the fifth day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The civilian death toll is mounting and humanitarian organizations are pleading for safe corridors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Governments around the world work to evacuate citizens caught up in the war in Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky makes a surprise visit to Brussels, seeking support for more advanced weaponry in the war against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Afghanistan's Herat province has been hit by a second strong earthquake within the space of a few days, with 130 reported injured in the latest tremor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Israel and Hamas continue to trade fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Israel and Hamas continue to trade fire. Around 2,300 targets have been hit in Gaza since Saturday's attack by Hamas militants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Humanitarian groups are pleading for the creation of corridors to get aid into the Palestinian-run coastal strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: With the near total blockade in place, aid organisations are warning that hospitals are overwhelmed with wounded people and are running out of supplies of food and water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Some of Israel's allies say the collective punishment of 2.2 million people, the vast majority of whom are innocent civilians, cannot be justified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile two Hamas senior officials have been confirmed dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Israel's government has promised to hunt down the militant group after their surprise assault last Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Diplomatic support is growing for Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is talking about possibly forming a government of national unity in the crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken is flying in on Thursday to show Israel has Washington's backing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The wave of militant attacks has shocked many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The discovery of dozens of bodies of families at Kfar Azagabutz near the border of Gaza has been condemned by U.S. President Joe Biden as a, quote, act of sheer evil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Netanyahu's military is also targeted two Hezbollah observation posts in response to rockets launched from southern Lebanon and levelled the upscale Ramal neighbourhood in the heart of Gaza City, packed with shopping malls, restaurants, aid group offices and to mass government ministries.

sentences.sentence: Several commercial airlines have cancelled services in and out of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: With many focused on the Israel-Hamas conflict, the Ukrainian president made an unannounced visit to NATO headquarters in Brussels, reminding the world that Kyiv is still at war with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy wants allies to supply more advanced weaponry, including anti-missile systems to protect infrastructure from Russian military strikes during the winter months.

sentences.sentence: Zelensky says the surprise attack in Israel on Saturday is comparable to the first days of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and he urged world leaders to unite with Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Europe's population is aging rapidly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Next year, it's estimated the over 65-year-olds will outnumber the under 15-year-olds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And habits and attitudes need to be adjusted accordingly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: That's the message of a World Health Organization report, which advocates healthier lifestyles to ensure well-being in advanced years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The starting point is better eating, the report says, and governments should be doing more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: To promote healthy diets, it's about reformulating foods, reducing the salt content of foods, eliminating trans fats, sugar consumption, also communication and public awareness campaigns specific to older adults could be beneficial, but also developing age-friendly environments through urban design and planning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Staying active and taking regular exercise is also crucial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The WHO says it's not just individuals who benefit from keeping fit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: individuals who benefit from keeping fit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We published a report in collaboration with the OECD earlier this year on the cost of physical inactivity on health systems in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We estimated that 8 billion euros per year could be saved if more people were physically active, meeting the Dubbo Cho recommended levels of physical activity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The report urges governments to adapt policies to enable older people to be more independent while maintaining social connections and contributing to society, all of which bring their own health benefits.
